conclusion: Read the coordinates of state A from the p-V diagram: p_A = 1×10⁵ Pa, V_A = 2 L = 2×10⁻³ m³, T_A = 200 K (given)
Read the coordinates of state B from the p-V diagram: p_B = 4×10⁵ Pa, V_B = 2 L = 2×10⁻³ m³
Read the coordinates of state C from the p-V diagram: p_C = 1×10⁵ Pa, V_C = 5 L = 5×10⁻³ m³
Use the ideal-gas law: pV = nRT
Calculate nR from state A: nR = (p_A V_A) / T_A = 1 J K⁻¹
For comparison, R = 8.314 J mol⁻¹ K⁻¹, so the amount of gas is n = 1/8.314 ≃ 0.120 mol.
Determine the temperature at state C: T_C = (p_C V_C) / (nR) = 500 K
Final Answer: The temperature of the gas at state C is 500 K.
